title: Cardano Basics Quiz
description: Test your Cardano knowledge with this short quiz.

questions.question: What is a "dapp"?
options: A decentralized application running on a blockchain
questions.explanation: A dapp (decentralized application) is an application that runs on a blockchain network rather than being controlled by a single entity. On Cardano, dapps leverage smart contracts to provide trustless services.

questions.question: What is an address on Cardano?
options: A string used to receive and send ada
questions.explanation: A Cardano address is a unique identifier that allows you to receive and send ada. It's derived from your wallet's cryptographic keys and can be safely shared with others.

questions.question: What does "immutable ledger" mean?
questions.explanation: An immutable ledger means that once data is recorded on the blockchain, it cannot be changed or deleted. This creates a permanent, tamper-proof record of all transactions.

questions.question: What does "wallet balance" show?
questions.explanation: Your wallet balance displays the total amount of ada that you have control over through your private keys. This includes both available and staked ada.

questions.question: What is the purpose of metadata in a transaction?
options: To add optional information to a transaction
questions.explanation: Transaction metadata allows you to attach additional information to a Cardano transaction, such as messages, labels, or structured data. This is optional and doesn't affect the core transaction logic.
